2. Foundation#

This foundation is organised into a logical consistent flow explaining concepts and how the concepts are related. This section focuses more developing the theory of logic involved in solving puzzles, mostly leaving the practical application of this theory to the next chapter on Human Solvable Patterns to on the theory that

In the effort to be consistent and unambiguous, some terms have been refined or renamed to be:

  • less overloaded,

  • more consistent,

  • more self descriptive, and

  • relate better within the context that they are described.

To keep the reach of this text as wide as possible, verbal or algorithmic descriptions replace less common algebraic symbols and esoteric formulae.
